title: 5 Second Company Research
description: This Perplexity.ai prompt will empower you to research a company's critical details in seconds using the power of AI. Received an unexpected screening call from a recruiter? Plop this in in the first 30 seconds and get a great overview of some of the company details.
promptText:
I'm looking to research COMPANY NAME. 
Fill out the following fields.

Format the outputs as a table like this:
FIELD | INFORMATION

SOCIAL MEDIA LINKS (format output as a table)
Website: 
Twitter Link: 
Instagram Link: 
Facebook Link
Tiktok Link:
LinkedIn Link: 
YouTube Link:
Glassdoor Company Link:
Indeed Company Link:
Crunchbase Link:

Format the outputs as a table like this:
FIELD | INFORMATION

COMPANY INFO (format output as a table)
Brief Description:
Brief Origin Story:
Founded Year:
Years in Operation:
Founder Name:
Current CEO/Leader:
Company Values:

Format the outputs as a table like this:
FIELD | INFORMATION

BUSINESS DETAILS (format output as a table)
Annual Revenue:
Stock Ticker (if available):
Current Stock Price (if available):
Stock Price Change Over 1Y, 3Y, 5Y:
Company Business Model:
Core Products/Services: 
Biggest Competitors:
Weaknesses (Compared to Competitors):
Strengths (Compared to Competitors):
Company Priorities:
Biggest Challenges:
Recent Funding/Investment:
Recent Round of Layoffs:

Format the outputs as a table like this:
FIELD | DATE | INFORMATION

NEWS (format output as a table)
Top Recent News Headline:
2nd Top Recent News Headline:
3rd Top Recent News Headline:
Latest LinkedIn Post Text:
Latest Facebook Post Text:
Latest Twitter Tweet Text:

Output format: Markdown tables

title: Break Down Job Descriptions
description: This powerful ChatGPT prompt will help you quickly break down and decipher the key requirements listed in a job description. It will also suggest relevant experiences to mention and even a sample achievement to provide some context in an application. This detailed guidance is especially helpful for tailoring applications to specific job roles.
promptText:
List all the desired skills from the job description below. Create a table with the following 3 columns: 

1. Skill: A brief 2-3 word summary of the skill
2. Required?: Options (Yes, Nice-to-Have)
3. Suggestions: Types of achievements to highlight

Example Output:

**Desired Skills**
Skill | Required? | Suggestions:
Policy Development and Implementation	| Yes | Describe a measurable achievement in developing and implementing privacy policies. What was a measurable outcome?

# Once that table is complete, create another table, that lists any additional skills and experience that would be beneficial to list that are not directly mentioned.

Format the output in a table like the example below:

Example Output:

**Skills Not Directly Mentioned**
Skill | Required? | Suggestions
Stakeholder Management |	Yes	| Describe an achievement where you collaborated across multiple stakeholder groups. What was a measurable outcome?

[COPY/PASTE FULL JOB DESCRIPTION HERE]

Output format: Markdown tables

title: Career Highlights Matrix
description: This ChatGPT prompt is a career coaching tool for job seekers to organize key aspects of their roles in a clear markdown table. It helps users identify common tasks, metrics, skills, tools, outcomes, time frames, challenges, and recognitions. This structured approach aids in preparing for interviews, updating resumes, and understanding one's career achievements, enabling job seekers to effectively showcase their expertise to potential employers.
promptText:
[Job Title] = YOUR JOB TITLE
[Field/Industry] = YOUR FIELD/INDUSTRY

#TASK:
Act like a career coach. Create a table to help job seekers brainstorm common tasks, metrics, skills, tools, outcomes, time, frames, challenges, and awards in their field.

#OUTPUT:
The output should only be what is described below and no other text.
Replace the data with results relevant to the job title and industry above. 
Output as a markdown table.

| Most Common Tasks            | Quantifiable Metrics | Skills Utilized            | Common Tools/Software | Outcome/Impact                       | Time Frame             | Challenges Overcome    | Recognition/Awards                   |
|------------------------------|----------------------|----------------------------|-----------------------|--------------------------------------|------------------------|------------------------|---------------------------------------|
| Customer Onboarding          | Customer Satisfaction| Customer Engagement        | Salesforce            | Increased Customer Retention         | Quarterly Check-ins    | Churn Reduction        | Customer Success Excellence Award    |
| Account Management           | Churn Rate           | Account Management         | HubSpot               | Improved User Satisfaction           | Monthly Reviews        | Onboarding Process     | SaaS Industry Leader                 |
| Customer Training            | Net Promoter Score   | Relationship Building      | Zendesk               | Higher Renewal Rates                 | Weekly Updates         | Customer Retention     | Top Customer Advocate                |
| Renewal Management           | Customer Retention   | Product Knowledge          | Intercom              | Enhanced Customer Loyalty            | Daily Touchpoints      | Product Adoption       | Outstanding Client Support           |
| Customer Support             | Customer Onboarding  | Communication Skills       | Gainsight             | Reduced Churn Rate                   | Onboarding Process     | Account Expansion      | Customer Satisfaction Champion       |
| Upselling Opportunities      | Customer Engagement  | Problem Solving            | Customer.io           | Streamlined Onboarding Process       | Training Sessions      | Data Analysis          | Client Retention Expert              |
| Customer Feedback            | Upsell Opportunities | Client Onboarding          | Freshdesk             | Proactive Customer Support           | Customer Feedback      | Communication Skills   | Customer Success Innovator           |
| Product Adoption             | Renewal Rate         | Customer Retention         | Totango               | Personalized Customer Interactions   | Product Demos          | Time Management        | SaaS Customer Hero                   |
| Customer Satisfaction        | Customer Health      | Technical Aptitude         | ChurnZero             | Upsell Opportunities Identified      | Account Renewals       | Customer Satisfaction  | Exceptional Customer Service         |
| Customer Retention           | Time to Resolution   | Data Analysis              | Mixpanel              | Customer Feedback Implemented        | Churn Analysis         | Training Programs      | Customer Engagement Star             |
| Churn Analysis               | Customer Feedback    | Training Delivery          | Pendo                 | Improved Product Adoption            | Support Tickets        | Cross-functional Collaboration | SaaS Success Specialist          |
| Customer Communication       | Product Adoption     | Project Management         | UserIQ                | Customer Issue Resolution            | Success Plans          | Technical Support      | Client Relationship Guru             |
| Customer Success Plans       | Customer Lifetime Value | Cross-functional Collaboration | Drift            | Customer Success Plans Developed     | Usage Metrics          | Customer Feedback      | Customer Retention Pro               |
| Customer Advocacy            | Customer Referrals   | Upselling Techniques       | Amplitude             | Increased Product Engagement         | Feature Requests       | Upselling Techniques   | SaaS Customer Experience Award       |
| Cross-Selling Initiatives    | Customer Support Tickets | Customer Satisfaction    | CustomerGauge         | Customer Health Monitoring           | Customer Advocacy      | Performance Metrics    | Top Customer Success Manager         |
| Customer Health Monitoring   | Customer Success Plans | Feedback Collection      | ClientSuccess         | Customer Training Programs           | Performance Reports    | Customer Segmentation  | Client Success Trailblazer           |
| Customer Relationship Building | Customer Segmentation | Performance Metrics      | Natero                | Customer Success Metrics Tracked     | Satisfaction Surveys   | Problem Resolution     | Customer Loyalty Expert              |
| Customer Feedback Analysis   | Customer Training    | Software Implementation    | WalkMe                | Customer Success KPIs Achieved       | Upsell Opportunities   | Customer Engagement    | SaaS Customer Satisfaction Award     |
| Customer Success Metrics     | Customer Advocacy    | Customer Advocacy          | Userlane              | Customer Success Best Practices Shared | Quarterly Business Reviews | Renewal Rates | Outstanding Customer Success Performance |
| Customer Engagement          | Customer Escalations | Renewal Strategies         | Appcues               | Customer Success Workshops Conducted | Customer Health Scores | Competitive Analysis   | Client Success Champion              |
| Customer Lifecycle Management | Customer Surveys    | Conflict Resolution        | Wootric               | Customer Success Webinars Hosted     | Onsite Visits          | Customer Advocacy      | Customer Support Superstar           |
| Customer Success Reviews     | Customer Demographics | Customer Support          | Qualtrics             | Customer Success Case Studies Published | Webinar Presentations | Customer Success Plans | SaaS Customer Retention Award        |
| Customer Success Reporting   | Customer Interactions | Market Research           | Medallia              | Customer Success Advocacy Programs Launched | User Adoption Rates | Customer Health Scores | Top Customer Success Advocate        |
| Customer Success Strategy    | Customer Communication | Presentation Skills      | SurveyMonkey          | Customer Success Community Engagement | Customer Retention Rates | Customer Journey Mapping | Client Engagement Leader            |
| Customer Success KPIs        | Customer Success Metrics | Negotiation Tactics     | Slack                 | Customer Success Team Collaboration  | Customer Lifetime Value | Customer Relationship Management | Customer Success Achievement Award |

Output format: Markdown table

title: Create Company Scorecards
description: One of the biggest keys to motivation, networking, and landing a job is staying current with recent industry news. Use this prompt to quickly create a list of podcasts, newsletters, communities, companies and specific influencers in your field to stay in the loop on current events.
promptText:
[Field/Industry] = YOUR FIELD OR INDUSTRY
[Job Title] = YOUR JOB TITLE OR TARGET ROLE

Generate a list of 10 companies in the [Field/Industry] where someone with my background as a [Job Title] might want to work. 

For each company, create a scorecard with the following details in a table format:

FIELD | INFORMATION
Company Name:
Website:
LinkedIn URL:
Brief Description:
Founded Year:
Current CEO:
Company Size (# of employees):
Annual Revenue (if public):
Recent Funding Round:
Notable Products/Services:
Company Culture Highlights:
Recent News/Updates:
Why This Company (for someone in my role):

Output format: Markdown tables

title: Create Your Skills Section
description: This ChatGPT prompt helps you generate a comprehensive skills section for your resume by analyzing your professional background and industry standards. It creates a well-organized list of technical skills, soft skills, and tools that are relevant to your target role.
promptText:
[Job Title] = YOUR JOB TITLE
[Industry] = YOUR INDUSTRY
[Years of Experience] = NUMBER OF YEARS

Based on a [Job Title] with [Years of Experience] years of experience in [Industry], generate a comprehensive skills section for a resume.

Include:
1. Technical Skills (software, tools, platforms, methodologies)
2. Soft Skills (leadership, communication, problem-solving, etc.)
3. Industry-Specific Skills

Format the output as a clean list organized by category. Make it scannable and ATS-friendly.

Example Output:

**Technical Skills**
‚Ä¢ Software: [List relevant software]
‚Ä¢ Tools: [List relevant tools]
‚Ä¢ Methodologies: [List relevant methodologies]

**Professional Skills**
‚Ä¢ [Skill 1]
‚Ä¢ [Skill 2]
‚Ä¢ [Skill 3]

**Industry Expertise**
‚Ä¢ [Industry skill 1]
‚Ä¢ [Industry skill 2]

Output format: Markdown

title: Create a Compelling Career Story
description: This prompt helps you craft a narrative that connects your past experiences to your current career goals in a compelling way. It's useful for interviews, LinkedIn summaries, and networking conversations where you need to explain your professional journey.
promptText:
I need help creating a compelling career story. Here's my background:

[Current Role]:
[Previous Role(s)]:
[Career Goal]:
[Key Skills]:
[Notable Achievements]:

Please create a career narrative that:
1. Explains the logical progression of my career
2. Highlights key turning points or decisions
3. Connects my past experience to my future goals
4. Showcases my unique value proposition
5. Is conversational and authentic (60-90 seconds when spoken)

Format it as a story I can use in interviews when asked "Tell me about your career journey" or "Walk me through your resume."

Output format: Markdown

title: Create a Quick Prospective Company List
description: This prompt helps you quickly identify companies that align with your skills, values, and career goals. It generates a targeted list of potential employers to research and pursue.
promptText:
[Industry/Field] = YOUR TARGET INDUSTRY
[Job Title] = YOUR TARGET ROLE
[Location Preference] = YOUR PREFERRED LOCATION (or "Remote")
[Company Size Preference] = STARTUP / MID-SIZE / ENTERPRISE / ANY
[Values/Priorities] = WHAT'S IMPORTANT TO YOU (e.g., work-life balance, innovation, social impact)

Create a list of 20 companies where I should apply based on the following criteria:
- Industry: [Industry/Field]
- Role: [Job Title]
- Location: [Location Preference]
- Company Size: [Company Size Preference]
- My Values: [Values/Priorities]

For each company, provide:
1. Company Name
2. Brief Description (1-2 sentences)
3. Why It's a Good Fit
4. Website URL

Organize as a table with columns: Company | Description | Why It Fits | Website

Output format: Markdown table

title: Find Recruiters
description: This prompt helps you identify and connect with recruiters who specialize in your industry and target role. It provides strategies for finding the right recruiters on LinkedIn and other platforms.
promptText:
[Industry] = YOUR INDUSTRY
[Job Title] = YOUR TARGET JOB TITLE
[Location] = YOUR TARGET LOCATION

Help me find recruiters specializing in [Industry] for [Job Title] roles in [Location].

Provide:
1. Types of recruiters to target (agency, corporate, executive search, etc.)
2. LinkedIn search strategies (Boolean search strings)
3. Key recruiting firms in my industry
4. How to identify if a recruiter is right for me
5. Best practices for reaching out to recruiters

Also include a sample LinkedIn message template I can use to introduce myself to a recruiter.

Output format: Markdown

title: Generate Taglines For Your LinkedIn Banner Image
description: This ChatGPT prompt is designed to assist you in generating attention-grabbing taglines for your LinkedIn banner that will intrigue employers. It helps you create industry-specific value propositions that highlight your unique skills and qualities, making your profile stand out.
promptText:
[Job Title] = YOUR JOB TITLE
[Field/Industry] = YOUR FIELD/INDUSTRY

Here are a number of job-seeker slogans. Write a list of 20 more slogans like this that a job seeker can use to stand out and attract employers to interview them. 

Each slogan must present a specific skill or value proposition that will be of interest to potential employers. 

Syntax Perfected, User Experience Elevated
The Risk Mitigator: Internal Controls for Secure Financials
Front-end Magic, Back-end Brilliance
Fort Knox for Web Apps: Top-Tier Security Consulting
Breaking Barriers, Not Websites
Bulletproof Web Apps Through Automated Testing
Turning User Data into Actionable Insights
Transforming Financial Data into Strategic Assets
Tax Planning that Turns Savings into Investments
Simplifying Mergers and Acquisitions: Due Diligence Done Right

# Output: 
- Format the output as a 2-column markdown table. | Description | Tagline |

Output format: Markdown table

title: Generate 'Tell Me About Yourself'
description: This prompt helps you craft a compelling and personalized answer to the common interview question "Tell Me About Yourself" using your resume and the job description to highlight your most relevant skills and experiences.
promptText:
As a career coaching assistant, help the job seeker craft a compelling and personalized answer to the interview question "Tell Me About Yourself." Use their resume and the job description to highlight their most relevant skills and experiences. Follow the template below to structure the answer.

Inputs: (use a made up resume and job description for the time being)

Template:

1. Introduction:
   ‚Ä¢ State your name and professional title.
   ‚Ä¢ Mention your current or most recent role and company.
2. Most Recent Professional Background:
   ‚Ä¢ Highlight most recent relevant professional experience 
   ‚Ä¢ Highlight a significant quantified achievement with metrics, very specific actions taken and impressive results to showcase your value. 
3. Alignment with the Role:
   ‚Ä¢ Identify the top 2-3 requirements from the job description.
   ‚Ä¢ Explain how your skills and experiences align with these needs, providing specific examples.
4. Unique Value Proposition:
   ‚Ä¢ Share what sets you apart, such as unique skills or perspectives.
5. Closing:
   ‚Ä¢ Express enthusiasm for the role and company.
   ‚Ä¢ Mention why you're excited about this opportunity.

Keep the answer between 60-90 seconds when spoken aloud.

Output format: Markdown

title: Help me Quantify My Achievements
description: This prompt helps you transform vague job responsibilities into specific, quantifiable achievements that demonstrate your impact. It's particularly useful for strengthening your resume and interview responses.
promptText:
I need help quantifying my achievements for my resume. Here's my current responsibility/achievement:

[PASTE YOUR CURRENT BULLET POINT OR DESCRIPTION]

Please help me:
1. Identify the key metrics that could be measured (time saved, money saved, revenue generated, efficiency gained, etc.)
2. Suggest questions I should ask myself to find these numbers
3. Rewrite the achievement with estimated quantifiable results if I don't have exact numbers
4. Provide 3 variations: conservative estimate, moderate estimate, and strong estimate

Format:

**Questions to Help Find Your Numbers:**
- [Question 1]
- [Question 2]
- [Question 3]

**Quantified Versions:**

Conservative: [achievement with lower estimates]
Moderate: [achievement with realistic estimates]
Strong: [achievement with impressive but honest estimates]

Output format: Markdown

title: Identify Employer Objections/Concerns
description: This prompt helps you anticipate potential concerns employers might have about your candidacy and prepare strong responses. It's especially useful for career changers or those with employment gaps.
promptText:
Based on my resume below, identify potential objections or concerns an employer might have about hiring me for [TARGET ROLE].

For each concern:
1. State the potential objection
2. Explain why it might be a concern
3. Provide a strategy to address it
4. Include a sample response I could use in an interview

[PASTE YOUR RESUME]

Target Role: [JOB TITLE]

Common concerns to consider:
- Career gaps
- Lack of specific experience
- Career changes
- Over/under qualification
- Job hopping
- Industry changes
- Educational background

Output format: Markdown

title: Informational Interview Request Email
description: This prompt helps you craft professional and compelling emails to request informational interviews with professionals in your target industry or role.
promptText:
Help me write an email requesting an informational interview.

Details:
- Contact Name: [THEIR NAME]
- Contact's Role: [THEIR JOB TITLE]
- Contact's Company: [COMPANY NAME]
- How I found them: [HOW YOU DISCOVERED THEM - e.g., LinkedIn, mutual connection, company website]
- What caught my interest: [SPECIFIC DETAIL - recent article, project, career path, etc.]
- My current situation: [YOUR CURRENT ROLE/STATUS]
- What I'm hoping to learn: [SPECIFIC TOPICS OR QUESTIONS]

Create an email that:
1. Is concise (under 150 words)
2. Shows genuine interest and research
3. Respects their time (asking for 15-20 minutes)
4. Suggests flexible scheduling
5. Makes it easy to say yes
6. Doesn't ask for a job directly

Subject line ideas:
- [PROVIDE 3 OPTIONS]

Email body:
- [PROVIDE COMPLETE EMAIL]

Output format: Markdown

title: Job-Specific Informational Interview Questions
description: This prompt generates tailored questions you should ask during informational interviews based on the specific role, company, or industry you're exploring.
promptText:
[Target Role] = JOB TITLE YOU'RE EXPLORING
[Industry] = INDUSTRY
[Company] = COMPANY NAME (if applicable)
[Your Background] = BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF YOUR EXPERIENCE

Generate 15-20 thoughtful informational interview questions I should ask someone working as a [Target Role] in [Industry].

Organize the questions into these categories:

1. **Role & Responsibilities** (4-5 questions)
   - Day-to-day work
   - Key challenges
   - Success metrics

2. **Skills & Qualifications** (3-4 questions)
   - Required vs. nice-to-have skills
   - How to build relevant experience
   - Common career paths

3. **Company & Culture** (3-4 questions)
   - Team structure
   - Work environment
   - Growth opportunities

4. **Industry Insights** (3-4 questions)
   - Trends and changes
   - Future outlook
   - Advice for newcomers

5. **Personal Experience** (2-3 questions)
   - Their career journey
   - Lessons learned
   - Recommendations

Make the questions open-ended and show genuine curiosity. Avoid yes/no questions.

Output format: Markdown

title: LinkedIn Boolean Search String Generator
description: This prompt helps you create powerful Boolean search strings for LinkedIn to find exactly the right people - recruiters, hiring managers, or professionals in your target field.
promptText:
[Target Role] = JOB TITLE YOU'RE SEARCHING FOR
[Industry] = INDUSTRY
[Location] = CITY/STATE/REGION
[Company Size] = STARTUP / SMALL / MEDIUM / LARGE / ENTERPRISE
[Additional Criteria] = ANY OTHER REQUIREMENTS

Create LinkedIn Boolean search strings for:

1. **Finding Recruiters** who specialize in [Target Role] in [Industry]
2. **Finding Hiring Managers** at companies in [Industry]
3. **Finding Professionals** currently working as [Target Role]

For each search string, provide:
- The complete Boolean string
- What field to search in (Title, Company, etc.)
- How to refine results
- Tips for using the results

Example format:
**Search String:** ("recruiter" OR "talent acquisition") AND ([Industry]) AND ([Location])
**Where to use:** LinkedIn People search
**Filter by:** [Additional filters]
**How to use results:** [Tips for outreach]

Output format: Markdown

title: Post-Interview Analysis
description: This prompt helps you analyze your interview performance, identify areas for improvement, and prepare for follow-up actions. Use it immediately after an interview while details are fresh.
promptText:
Help me analyze my recent interview and plan my next steps.

Interview Details:
- Company: [COMPANY NAME]
- Role: [JOB TITLE]
- Interview Date: [DATE]
- Interviewer(s): [NAMES AND TITLES]
- Interview Format: [PHONE/VIDEO/IN-PERSON, PANEL/ONE-ON-ONE]

What went well:
[LIST 3-5 THINGS THAT WENT WELL]

What could have been better:
[LIST 2-3 AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT]

Questions I struggled with:
[LIST ANY DIFFICULT QUESTIONS]

Key points discussed:
[LIST MAIN TOPICS/THEMES]

Information I learned about the role/company:
[NEW INSIGHTS]

Based on this information:
1. Evaluate my performance (honest assessment)
2. Identify what the interviewer seemed most interested in
3. Suggest points to reinforce in my thank-you email
4. Recommend how to improve for next round (if applicable)
5. Draft talking points if they ask for references
6. Create a follow-up timeline and action items

Output format: Markdown

title: Prepare with Customized Interview Questions
description: This prompt generates a comprehensive list of likely interview questions tailored to a specific job description, helping you prepare thoroughly for upcoming interviews.
promptText:
Based on the job description below, generate a comprehensive list of interview questions I'm likely to be asked.

[PASTE FULL JOB DESCRIPTION]

Create questions in these categories:

1. **Role-Specific Technical Questions** (5-7 questions)
   - Questions about specific skills mentioned in the JD
   - Scenario-based questions related to key responsibilities

2. **Behavioral Questions** (5-7 questions)
   - Using STAR method format
   - Based on required competencies

3. **Company/Culture Fit Questions** (3-5 questions)
   - Based on company values (if mentioned)
   - Team collaboration scenarios

4. **Situational Questions** (3-5 questions)
   - Hypothetical scenarios related to the role
   - Problem-solving questions

For each question, also provide:
- Why they might ask this question
- Key points to cover in your answer
- A brief sample answer framework

Output format: Markdown

title: Rapidfire Salary Research
description: This prompt helps you quickly research salary ranges for your target role using AI, giving you data to support your salary negotiations.
promptText:
[Job Title] = TARGET JOB TITLE
[Industry] = INDUSTRY
[Location] = CITY/STATE
[Years of Experience] = NUMBER OF YEARS
[Company Size] = STARTUP/SMALL/MEDIUM/LARGE/ENTERPRISE

Research and provide salary information for a [Job Title] role with [Years of Experience] years of experience in [Industry] in [Location].

Provide:

1. **Salary Range**
   - Entry level: $X - $Y
   - Mid-level: $X - $Y
   - Senior level: $X - $Y

2. **Total Compensation Breakdown**
   - Base salary
   - Bonus/Commission structure
   - Equity/Stock options (if applicable)
   - Benefits (typical offerings)

3. **Factors That Influence Salary**
   - Company size impact
   - Industry variations
   - Location adjustments
   - In-demand skills that command premium pay

4. **Negotiation Insights**
   - Typical negotiation range (% above initial offer)
   - Non-salary benefits to negotiate
   - Red flags in compensation packages

5. **Resources for Further Research**
   - Websites to check
   - How to gather insider information

Include sources and note that these are estimates.

Output format: Markdown

title: Restructure Achievements to Highlight Metrics
description: This prompt takes your existing resume bullets and restructures them to lead with impressive metrics and quantifiable results, making your achievements more impactful.
promptText:
Take my current resume achievements below and restructure them to:
1. Lead with the most impressive metric/result
2. Use strong action verbs
3. Follow the format: [Result/Impact] by [Action] which [Additional Context]
4. Make them more specific and quantifiable

Current achievements:
[PASTE 3-5 BULLET POINTS FROM YOUR RESUME]

For each bullet point, provide:
- Original version
- Restructured version (leading with metrics)
- Alternative version (different angle)
- Suggestions for making it even stronger if you had additional data

Example transformation:
‚ùå Before: "Managed a team and improved customer satisfaction"
‚úÖ After: "Increased customer satisfaction by 35% (from 72% to 97%) by restructuring team workflow and implementing weekly coaching sessions for 12-person support team"

Output format: Markdown

title: Upcoming Industry Events
description: This prompt helps you discover relevant conferences, meetups, webinars, and networking events in your industry where you can learn, network, and potentially connect with employers.
promptText:
[Industry/Field] = YOUR INDUSTRY
[Location] = YOUR LOCATION (or "Virtual" for online events)
[Interests] = SPECIFIC TOPICS OR AREAS OF INTEREST
[Budget] = FREE / UNDER $100 / ANY

Find upcoming industry events, conferences, meetups, and networking opportunities in [Industry/Field].

Provide:

1. **Major Conferences** (next 6-12 months)
   - Event name
   - Date and location
   - Cost range
   - Why attend
   - Registration link

2. **Local Meetups & Networking Events**
   - In [Location]
   - Regular/recurring events
   - How to find them

3. **Virtual Events & Webinars**
   - Free options
   - Industry leaders hosting
   - Upcoming dates

4. **Professional Associations**
   - Organizations to join
   - Member benefits
   - Networking opportunities

5. **Tips for Maximizing Events**
   - How to prepare
   - Networking strategies
   - Follow-up best practices

Prioritize events related to [Interests] and within [Budget] budget.

Output format: Markdown

title: Write Achievements for Your Resume
description: This prompt helps you transform your job responsibilities into achievement-oriented bullet points that demonstrate impact and value to potential employers.
promptText:
Help me write achievement-focused bullet points for my resume.

Role Information:
- Job Title: [YOUR JOB TITLE]
- Company: [COMPANY NAME]
- Duration: [START DATE - END DATE]
- Industry: [INDUSTRY]

My main responsibilities were:
[LIST YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES]

Major projects I worked on:
[LIST 2-3 MAJOR PROJECTS]

Tools/technologies I used:
[LIST RELEVANT TOOLS]

For each of my responsibilities/projects, create achievement-oriented bullet points that:
1. Start with a strong action verb
2. Include specific metrics or quantifiable results
3. Show impact on company/team/customers
4. Demonstrate skills relevant to my target role
5. Are concise (1-2 lines maximum)

Provide 8-10 bullet points total, organized by:
- Major Achievements (3-4 bullets)
- Day-to-Day Impact (3-4 bullets)
- Skills & Tools (2-3 bullets)

If I don't have exact numbers, suggest metrics I should try to calculate or reasonable estimates.

Output format: Markdown

title: Write Discoverable LinkedIn Headlines
description: This prompt helps you craft LinkedIn headlines that are both compelling to humans and optimized for LinkedIn's search algorithm, increasing your discoverability to recruiters.
promptText:
[Current Role] = YOUR CURRENT JOB TITLE
[Target Role] = JOB TITLE YOU'RE SEEKING
[Key Skills] = TOP 3-4 SKILLS
[Industry] = YOUR INDUSTRY
[Unique Value] = WHAT MAKES YOU DIFFERENT

Create 10 LinkedIn headline variations that are:
1. Under 220 characters
2. Keyword-optimized for recruiters searching for [Target Role]
3. Compelling to human readers
4. Include a mix of role, skills, and value proposition

For each headline, indicate:
- Character count
- Primary keywords used
- Best use case (e.g., "Use if actively job searching" or "Use if passively open to opportunities")

Example format:
"[Target Role] | [Key Skill 1] + [Key Skill 2] + [Key Skill 3] | [Value Proposition] | [Industry]"

Variations to include:
- Results-focused (leading with achievements)
- Skill-focused (highlighting expertise)
- Industry-focused (emphasizing sector knowledge)
- Problem-solver focused (what challenges you solve)
- Hybrid approaches

Also provide:
- Top keywords recruiters use when searching for [Target Role]
- Skills to include for maximum searchability
- Common mistakes to avoid

Output format: Markdown

title: Write Your LinkedIn Work Experience Section
description: This prompt helps you craft compelling LinkedIn work experience sections that showcase your achievements, attract recruiters, and support your professional brand.
promptText:
Help me write the work experience section for my LinkedIn profile.

Role Details:
- Job Title: [YOUR JOB TITLE]
- Company: [COMPANY NAME]
- Duration: [START DATE - END DATE]
- Industry: [INDUSTRY]

Key Responsibilities:
[LIST YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES]

Major Achievements:
[LIST 3-5 KEY ACHIEVEMENTS WITH METRICS IF AVAILABLE]

Skills Used:
[LIST RELEVANT SKILLS AND TOOLS]

Create a LinkedIn work experience section that:

1. **Opening Statement** (1-2 sentences)
   - Compelling overview of your role and impact
   - Sets context for what follows

2. **Key Achievements** (3-5 bullet points)
   - Lead with results/metrics
   - Show progression and growth
   - Demonstrate skills relevant to your target audience

3. **Skills & Tools** (optional section)
   - List if particularly relevant
   - Can be woven into achievement bullets instead

Make it:
- More conversational than a resume (LinkedIn style)
- Keyword-rich for search optimization
- Scannable with clear bullet points
- Focused on impact and results
- Appropriate length (not too long, not too sparse)

Also provide:
- Keywords to include for SEO
- Skills to tag in the "Skills" section
- Tips for making it stand out

Output format: Markdown

title: Write Your LinkedIn 'About Me' Summary
description: This prompt helps you create a compelling LinkedIn "About" section that tells your professional story, highlights your value, and encourages profile visitors to connect with you.
promptText:
Help me write a compelling LinkedIn "About" section.

Background:
- Current Role: [YOUR CURRENT ROLE]
- Years of Experience: [NUMBER OF YEARS]
- Industry: [YOUR INDUSTRY]
- Career Goals: [WHAT YOU'RE WORKING TOWARDS]
- Target Audience: [WHO SHOULD READ THIS - recruiters, clients, collaborators, etc.]

Key Points to Include:
- Top 3 skills or areas of expertise: [LIST]
- Notable achievements: [LIST 2-3]
- What you're passionate about professionally: [DESCRIBE]
- What makes you unique: [YOUR DIFFERENTIATOR]
- Current focus/what you're looking for: [DESCRIBE]

Create a LinkedIn About section that:

1. **Opening Hook** (1-2 sentences)
   - Grabs attention immediately
   - Sets the tone for what follows

2. **Professional Story** (2-3 paragraphs)
   - Your background and experience
   - Key achievements and impact
   - What drives you professionally

3. **Skills & Expertise** (1 paragraph)
   - Core competencies
   - Areas where you add value
   - Industries/domains you know well

4. **Current Focus** (1 paragraph)
   - What you're working on now
   - What opportunities interest you
   - How people can work with you

5. **Call to Action** (1-2 sentences)
   - How to connect with you
   - What kind of conversations you welcome

Make it:
- Written in first person ("I" not "he/she")
- Conversational but professional
- Scannable with paragraph breaks
- Around 200-300 words total
- Keyword-optimized for search
- Authentic to your voice

Provide 2 variations:
1. Professional tone (for corporate/traditional industries)
2. Conversational tone (for startups/creative industries)

Output format: Markdown

title: Write a Post-Interview Thank You Email
description: This prompt helps you craft professional and memorable thank-you emails that reinforce your candidacy and keep you top-of-mind with interviewers.
promptText:
Help me write a post-interview thank you email.

Interview Details:
- Interviewer Name: [NAME]
- Interviewer Title: [THEIR POSITION]
- Company: [COMPANY NAME]
- Position: [JOB TITLE]
- Interview Date: [DATE]
- Interview Format: [PHONE/VIDEO/IN-PERSON]

Key Topics Discussed:
[LIST 2-3 MAIN TOPICS OR THEMES FROM THE INTERVIEW]

What I Want to Reinforce:
[MENTION 1-2 KEY QUALIFICATIONS OR FIT POINTS]

Additional Information to Include (if any):
[ANY FOLLOW-UP ITEMS, MATERIALS TO SEND, OR ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS YOU COULDN'T FULLY ADDRESS]

Create an email that:
1. Thanks them for their time
2. References specific conversation points (shows you were engaged)
3. Reinforces your interest and fit
4. Provides any promised follow-up materials
5. Reiterates enthusiasm for the role
6. Keeps the door open for next steps
7. Is concise (under 200 words)
8. Strikes the right tone (professional but warm)

Provide:
- Subject line (3 options)
- Email body
- Timing recommendation (when to send)
- Whether to send individual emails if multiple interviewers

Output format: Markdown

title: Write a Professional Summary
description: This prompt helps you create a powerful professional summary for your resume that immediately communicates your value and captures hiring managers' attention.
promptText:
Help me write a professional summary for my resume.

Background:
- Current/Most Recent Title: [JOB TITLE]
- Years of Experience: [NUMBER]
- Industry: [INDUSTRY]
- Target Role: [ROLE YOU'RE APPLYING FOR]
- Key Skills: [LIST TOP 5-6 SKILLS]
- Top Achievements: [LIST 2-3 WITH METRICS IF POSSIBLE]
- Certifications/Education: [RELEVANT CREDENTIALS]
- What Makes You Unique: [YOUR DIFFERENTIATOR]

Create 3 versions of a professional summary:

**Version 1: Traditional Format** (3-4 lines)
- Start with years of experience and title
- Include key skills and industries
- Highlight 1-2 major achievements
- End with what you're known for

**Version 2: Achievement-Led Format** (3-4 lines)
- Lead with most impressive metric/achievement
- Connect to your expertise and background
- Emphasize value you bring
- End with areas of specialization

**Version 3: Hybrid Format** (3-4 lines)
- Combine approach
- Balance credentials with results
- Incorporate target role keywords
- Show career progression

For each version:
- Keep under 4 lines
- Use strong action words
- Include specific metrics
- Incorporate keywords from target role
- Make it ATS-friendly
- Ensure it's tailored to the target position

Also provide:
- Keywords to include based on target role
- Common mistakes to avoid
- Tips for customizing for each application

Output format: Markdown

title: Write a Recommendation on LinkedIn
description: This prompt helps you write thoughtful, specific LinkedIn recommendations that genuinely help your colleagues and strengthen your professional relationships.
promptText:
Help me write a LinkedIn recommendation.

Person Details:
- Name: [THEIR NAME]
- Current Role: [THEIR JOB TITLE]
- Company: [THEIR COMPANY]
- How I know them: [e.g., "Worked together at X", "They reported to me", "We collaborated on Y project"]
- Duration of working relationship: [TIME PERIOD]

Context:
- Their key strengths: [LIST 2-3 STRENGTHS]
- Specific examples of their work: [DESCRIBE 1-2 SITUATIONS WHERE THEY EXCELLED]
- Impact they made: [DESCRIBE RESULTS/OUTCOMES]
- Skills they demonstrated: [LIST RELEVANT SKILLS]
- What made them stand out: [THEIR UNIQUE QUALITIES]

Create a LinkedIn recommendation that:
1. Starts with context of how you worked together
2. Highlights specific achievements or qualities
3. Provides concrete examples
4. Shows genuine enthusiasm
5. Helps their career goals
6. Is 3-4 paragraphs (150-250 words)
7. Feels authentic, not generic

Make it:
- Specific (avoid clich√©s like "team player" without examples)
- Professional but warm
- Focused on impact and results
- Helpful for their job search or career advancement
- Honest and credible

Provide:
- Full recommendation text
- Key phrases to emphasize
- Skills to endorse separately in their profile

Output format: Markdown

title: Write an Effective #OpenToWork Post for LinkedIn
description: This prompt helps you create a compelling LinkedIn post announcing your job search that attracts opportunities while maintaining professionalism and dignity.
promptText:
Help me write an #OpenToWork post for LinkedIn.

Your Situation:
- Current Status: [e.g., "Recently laid off", "Actively seeking", "Open to new opportunities while employed"]
- Target Role(s): [JOB TITLES YOU'RE SEEKING]
- Industries of Interest: [LIST INDUSTRIES]
- Location Preference: [CITY/STATE or REMOTE]
- Your Background: [BRIEF SUMMARY - e.g., "10 years in marketing with expertise in X, Y, Z"]
- What You're Looking For: [COMPANY SIZE, CULTURE, ROLE TYPE, etc.]

Key Points to Convey:
- Your top 3-4 skills
- What kind of impact you make
- What you're passionate about
- Types of opportunities you want

Create an #OpenToWork post that:

1. **Opening** (1-2 sentences)
   - Clear, confident statement about your search
   - Sets positive, professional tone

2. **Background** (2-3 sentences)
   - Relevant experience and expertise
   - Key achievements or areas of impact
   - Industries/domains you know

3. **What You're Looking For** (2-3 sentences)
   - Specific about role types
   - Clear about preferences (remote, location, etc.)
   - Conveys enthusiasm and value you bring

4. **Call to Action** (1-2 sentences)
   - How people can help
   - How to connect with you

Make it:
- Confident but not desperate
- Specific enough to be helpful, broad enough to get opportunities
- Professional with personality
- Under 300 words
- Easy to share/forward

Provide 2 versions:
1. Standard professional version
2. More personal/vulnerable version (if you were laid off)

Include:
- Suggested hashtags (#OpenToWork, #JobSearch, industry-specific tags)
- Best time to post
- How to engage with comments/responses

Output format: Markdown

title: Write an Elevator Pitch
description: This prompt helps you create compelling elevator pitches that succinctly communicate your professional value in various situations like networking events, career fairs, or chance encounters.
promptText:
I'd like you to act as a career coach and communication coach. I will paste in a resume below. Based on that resume, generate 5 different elevator pitch variations using the following formats:

---

Template 1: Quick & Clear  
Use this structure:
- Name  
- Current or most recent role or professional identity  
- Key skills or specializations  
- A clear achievement or experience highlight  
- What role or opportunity they're currently seeking  

---

Template 2: Impact-Oriented  
Use this structure:
- Name and role/industry  
- One or two strong, quantified achievements  
- Area of expertise  
- What role or opportunity they're targeting now  

Please include a mix of roles that the person may be qualified for based on their resume‚Äîsuch as Developer Advocate, Project Manager, Technical Writer, Employee Experience Specialist, or Product Manager‚Äîand tailor each pitch slightly to align with that goal. Make sure each pitch is 30‚Äì45 seconds long when spoken aloud.

---

**Examples**:

üéØ 1. The "Quick & Clear" Pitch  
Perfect for introverts or high-traffic events  

Template:  
"Hi, I'm [Name]. I'm a [Job Title] with experience in [Industry or Key Skill Area], especially strong in [Top Skills]. I'm currently looking for [Target Role or Company Type], ideally where I can [What You Love Doing or Your Value Add]."

Example:  
"Hi, I'm Jordan. I'm a marketing strategist with 5+ years of experience in B2B tech. I specialize in lead gen and campaign performance, and I'm currently looking for a growth marketing role at a startup that values data and creativity."

üåü 2. The "Impact-Oriented" Pitch  
Great when you have strong metrics or want to stand out  

Template:  
"I'm [Name], a [Job Title or Field] who recently [Quantified Achievement or Project]. I specialize in [Key Skills], and I'm looking for opportunities in [Industry or Role] where I can drive similar results."

Example:  
"I'm Aisha, a customer success manager who helped reduce churn by 20% in 6 months through a new onboarding strategy. I love building strong client relationships and I'm looking for a role at a mission-driven SaaS company."

---

Once you're ready, I'll paste the resume below.

Output format: Markdown

title: Write an Email to the Hiring Manager
description: Is the thought of crafting that crucial email to a hiring manager giving you the jitters? This expertly designed ChatGPT prompt is your secret weapon. Simply plug in the job description, your resume, and watch as it generates a captivating, professionally-worded email tailored precisely to you.
promptText:
**Step 1:** Copy/Paste this prompt followed by the job description into ChatGPT then hit enter.

Here is a job posting I am interested in. Reply by saying "Ok, I have received this job posting for future reference" if you have received this information.

[COPY/PASTE FULL JOB DESCRIPTION]

**Step 2:** Copy/Paste this prompt followed by your resume into ChatGPT then hit enter.

Here is a copy of my resume. Reply with a one word comment saying "Ok, I have received your resume for future reference" if you have received this information.

[COPY/PASTE YOUR RESUME TEXT]

**Step 3:** Copy/Paste this prompt and your resume into ChatGPT

[Hiring Manager Name] = HIRING MANAGER NAME
[Your Full Name] = YOUR FULL NAME
[Company] = TARGET COMPANY NAME

Using my resume and the job description above, write an to the hiring manager of[Company] based on the 3 main priorities from the job description and outline how I am a good fit using my relevant achievements.

Use the template and format below and output as markdown.

"Hi [Hiring Manager Name],

My name is [YOUR FULL NAME] and I am writing to connect regarding the [JOB TITLE] role at [COMPANY NAME].

It sounds like the [TEAM/DEPARTMENT] team at [COMPANY] is looking for someone with [PRIORITY 1], [PRIORITY 2], and [PRIORITY 3].

Let me share how my experience aligns with these requirements:

**1. [PRIORITY 1]:** [TOP ACHIEVEMENT RELATED TO PRIORITY 1]

**2. [PRIORITY 1]:** [TOP ACHIEVEMENT RELATED TO PRIORITY 2]

**3. [PRIORITY 3]:** [TOP ACHIEVEMENT RELATED TO PRIORITY 3]

I'm confident that I'd make a stellar addition to the team and would love to chat more! Would you be open to a short 20-minute call on [SPECIFIC DATE AND TIME] to learn more about the role and the team?

Thanks in advance for your consideration! Looking forward to hearing from you!

All the best,

[YOUR FULL NAME]
[LINKEDIN URL]
[PHONE NUMBER]"

Example output: 

"Hi Jeff,

My name is James Smith and I am writing to express my interest in the Demand Planner role at McCain Foods.

It sounds like the team at McCain Foods is looking for someone who can efficiently create and maintain a demand plan, incorporate key business intelligence into the demand signal, and lead a dialogue each month for their respective customers and products with key counterparts in Marketing and Sales.

Let me share how my experience aligns with these requirements:

**1. Efficient Creation and Maintenance of a Demand Plan:** I saved Advantage Solutions $50-100K per month by identifying and eliminating redundant or overlapping promotions through daily sales forecasting monitoring for 40+ SKUs.

**2. Incorporating Key Business Intelligence into the Demand Signal:** I saved Freshii $10K per month by optimizing the replenishment process with the warehousing and packaging teams, which reduced overstock instances by 60%.

**3. Leading Dialogue for Respective Customers and Products:** I managed a portfolio of $40M+ for major Canadian retailers including Walmart, Loblaws, Metro, and Sobeys. This involved constant communication and coordination with these key customers to manage their demands and expectations effectively.

I'm confident that I'd make a stellar addition to the McCain Foods team and would love to chat more! Would you be open to a short 20-minute call on Friday at 10:00am to learn more about the role and the team?

Thanks in advance for your consideration! Looking forward to hearing from you!

All the best,

James Smith
linkedin.com/in/jamessmith
647-000-0000"

Output format: Markdown
